name: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria (Günther Disease)
chief_complaint: My baby's skin blisters easily in sunlight, and their urine is dark red.
prognosis: Chronic debilitating disease with reduced life expectancy without transplant; HSCT can be curative but carries significant risks
description: An extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder of heme biosynthesis causing accumulation of uroporphyrin I in bones, teeth, and tissues. The condition presents in infancy with severe cutaneous photosensitivity and hemolytic anemia. The enzyme defect is in uroporphyrinogen III synthase (UROS gene).
